title: Intuitive User Interface Adaptation – Voice-Guided Navigation for All User Levels
summary: As an older adult, I want to use voice commands to navigate the system easily so that I can manage my daily tasks without struggling with complex technology.

title: User-Controlled Data Sharing Preferences
summary: As a retired social worker, I want to easily manage my data sharing preferences so that I can maintain control over my personal and health information while using the ALFRED system.

title: User-Centric Installation and Setup – Step-by-Step Voice-Assisted Process
summary: As a retired social worker, I want an easy and guided voice-assisted setup process for the ALFRED system so that I can quickly install and start using it without feeling overwhelmed by technology.

title: Cross-Device Compatibility for Communication
summary: As an older adult, I want to seamlessly connect ALFRED with my smartphone and tablet so that I can easily maintain communication with my family and stay updated on news and volunteering activities without complex configurations.

title: Comprehensive Accessibility Features – Cognitive Load-Reducing Interface Options
summary: As a retired social worker, I want an intuitive interface with cognitive load-reducing options so that I can easily navigate the system and manage my tasks without feeling overwhelmed.

title: Flexible User Experience Customization
summary: As a retired social worker, I want to customize my interactions with ALFRED based on my preferences and needs so that I can easily maintain social connections, manage my schedule, and stay updated on important issues without dealing with complex configurations.

title: Ongoing User Support Mechanisms – 24/7 Voice-Based Support Assistance
summary: As an older adult, I want a 24/7 voice-based support system so that I can easily access assistance whenever I need help with managing my daily tasks and staying connected with family and friends, especially during times of reduced mobility or arthritis pain.
